body.head:
Chain of Mission Stations
Liberia
West Coast Africa
Will You Help?

Address:
7 Sussex Avenue
East Orange, N.J. New Jersey
body.p:
Your name has been given to me as one especially able to ad-
vise wisely in a matter in which I am deeply interested.

I have been engaged for four years in British East Africa and
eight years in Liberia , West Coast Africa , bearing the torchlight
of our Christian civilization to my people in heathenism and sin.

After twelve years of personal, active service among them, I
am fully conscious of their needs, and I believe that planting a
chain of mission stations linked together and extending into the
interior will be a practicable way of meeting the needs of these un-
fortunate people.

In locating these stations, we shall be governed largely by
their accessibility, the good quality of timber available, and the
adaptability of the land to agriculture and stock-raising, as these
natural advantages will be a great asset in eventually make the,
stations, to a gegree, self-supporting.

The number of stations established will depend upon the amount
of funds and working implements we are able to secure for their
equipment and operation, and in these stations will be conducted on the
plan of social settlement work in this country, only on a larger scale.

We shall need not less than twenty thousand dollars ($20,000)
to equip and maintain these stations, and to employ an efficient
corps of competent workers.

Confident of your interest, I am making this appeal earnestly
soliciting your financial aid in raising the above-named amount for
the accomplishment of this work. Any contribution you may be pleased
to make will sincerely be appreciated and judiciously used for the work.

As to my integrity and ability, you may refer to Dr. Doctor J.H.
Hughes, Secretary of the Foreign Mission Board of New Jersey, 115
Oakwood Ave. Avenue, Orange, N.J. New Jersey ; Miss Lucy H. Tapley , President of The
Spelman Seminary , Atlanta, Ga. Georgia, the Institutiom Institution which I attended;
Ex-Pres. President Howard , Monrovia, Liberia under whose administration I
served; also Rev. Reverand H.C. Bailey , Pastor Antioch Baptist Church , 2244
E. East 43rd St. Street , Cleveland Ohio.

Thanking you in advance for any contribution you may make or
for any assistance you may render in placing me in touch with others
who you think may be interested in this great work for the redemp-
tion of Africa , I am
